I ride horses so I'm almost always in tight breeches. I just try to buy mid/high waist ones because I hate my stomach and hips. My riding tops are usually relatively loose fitting polo shirts but I tuck them in and wear a belt. As far as non horse riding clothing goes, I always wear skinny jeans. Again, high waisted ones only since I hate my stomach and hips. I tend to wear looser tops as well, but not too lose because then it makes my stomach and upper body look bigger than it actually is.

22 but yes I've found the weight isn't coming off as quickly as it did when I was a teenager. When I was a teen I'd drop 3 pounds in 2 days of restricting to 500 cals. Now, it's like .6 pounds per day.

I trawl through here on my main account occasionally to see what tips I can pick up
I'm gonna stop you right there. Tips to pick up a mental illness?
Okay JK I'm not going to stop you cos this is getting too good.
The scale is a terrible way to keep track of your journey
Yeah eating disorders aren't a journey. They're a mental illness. A journey has an ending point but for most people with eating disorders, there is no ending point. There is no stopping it.
You need to treat yourself
Yeah buddy, that's not how eating disorders work. Even if I *wanted* to treat myself, the ED voice in my head won't let me. Last night I was tempted to order pizza. I then proceeded to cry about pizza and how it'll make me fat. Didn't order the pizza.
I don't know what your logic was in posting this here, but try /r/loseit instead. Eating disorders are not a choice nor are they a lazy diet/quick fix for losing weight. For some people on this sub they may be but you're just invalidating majority of us who have spent days, weeks, months, years being sad and lonely, isolating ourselves from our friends and families, just to avoid food.

Edit; it was also so expensive I can't afford food lol, yay
Omg! I reached one of my goal weights yesterday so I bought myself a new horse riding helmet. It was *super* expensive and yeah I also have hardly any grocery money left for the rest of the month! :P

Have you tried Truvia? It's a stevia sweetener with 0 cal and to me it's just like having real sugar in my coffee. It does have 3g of carbs however I only need 1 packet of Truvia to sweeten up my coffee. Also I use this sugar free French vanilla creamer that's 15 cal per tablespoon and I find that 1 tablespoon is good enough, making my cup of coffee only 15 cal.

Morningstar Veggie Patty
I have these pretty much every night. With a few egg whites, they are a delicious, filling low cal meal.
This ^^ I'm 120 right now and I look much skinnier than I did when I was a teenager and 120. I'm an athlete now and I started working out.

Like, I know I needed food at that point, and it wasn't just me craving anything.
Literally me this morning. I fasted yesterday and usually after 24+ hours of fasting I like to eat soft foods like yoghurt or soup or drink some calories like a protein shake. But I knew I needed to get my blood sugar up or I'd pass out. I settled for a 100 cal granola bar.

I've been feeling similarly lately. I'm on my 15th day of consistent restricting and fasting. My heart has been beating very fast as well. I fasted yesterday (just had a few cups of coffee and water) and this morning I felt horrible. Like I got hit by a bus. It was hard to think, stand and walk straight. People say they have energy and mental clarity when they fast and I'm like....??? I know the symptoms would stop if I ate properly but noooope. ED brain won't let me. Bleh.
Thank you! Good luck to you as well :)

I consume 350 to 650 calories per day, averaging between 400 and 500. I don't think I've had a 650 day in over a week actually. So a high average for the week would be 4550 (wow that's such a hugely gross number) and a low average would be 2450. However, that does not take my 2-3 days of fasting per week into account.

The idea of "how many days can I keep this up?" is what really helped me during times I thought I'd have to eat above my calorie limit (like seeing friends and stuff). It kinda turned into a game. Although I really do miss seeing my friends :/

I think I lost 8-10 pounds. I didn't weigh myself when I started, only on the 3rd day I think. It's really not a lot but I had 2 plateaus during that time that lasted 2-3 days each. When I'd restrict I'd usually be down 0.6 pounds in the morning and when I'd fast I would be down 1.0-1.2 pounds in the morning.
Oh okay! Yeah as I said I don't know very well.
Thanks!!!
AFAIK you only gain muscle if you eat at a surplus. If anything, whatever fat you have will become a little more toned through lifting. Lifters on this sub would know better than I do.

Thank you! Thursday to Sunday morning will be those higher cal days since my mom is in town. Then *next* Friday to Sunday I'll be in Washington DC with her. So my weigh loss will probably slow down this month, but I'm still optimistic!
No problem!
Ah I see. Then really you can eat whatever you'd like/whatever you eat when you usually restrict. I highly doubt it'll hurt your stomach or anything to eat normal safe foods.

I'm here because of a reason similar to yours. I had about a year and a half of normalcy (and a year of being cigarette free) which caused me to gain weight. I tried losing weight the healthy way and it was so damn triggering. Counting calories, weighing food, being obsessive. It brought back all my old ED habits and behaviors.
Welcome to the community :) I hope you are able to find peace with whatever your struggles are.

How long did you fast for? I never fast for more than 36 hours so it's really not a big deal for me to go back eating my regular restricting safe foods. I just came off a 36 hour fast and typically the morning of ending a fast I'll have yoghurt or a protein shake but today I had a granola bar and I feel fine.

WRITING.TITLE: Small Victory: 14 days of continuous restricting
WRITING.TEXT:
Yesterday was my 14th day of not eating above my calorie limit. I think one day I hit 700 but I was really physically active that day so my net was around 300-400. Restricting and even fasting has become so easy. I still don't think I can fast for more than 36 hours considering how active I am 4 out of 7 days a week, but still.
In February through mid March I was trying to lose weight the healthy way by eating anywhere between 1000 and 1400 calories a day and I hated it. I constantly had cravings and was overall miserable. But now that I'm back to acting like my stupid 14 year old anorexic self, I feel so much better. I don't know why it's so much easier to eat less.
The only cravings I had were yesterday and I actually fasted yesterday. I craved Chipotle in the afternoon because I was hanging out with some people who were eating it. Later on I craved pizza and was *so* close to ordering delivery but I made a cup of coffee and the craving went away.
Anyways, just wanted to share my victory with you guys! Even when I was anorexic as a teenager and made it to my lowest wight (92) I don't think I ever had 14 continuous days of staying at/under my calorie limit. On Wednesday it'll be 17 continuous days and that'll end my streak as my mom and her boyfriend are visiting. I'll probably be eating 1000 calories a day while they're here. She'll be cooking a lot so I can't really track how many calories are in the food aside from the gross underestimation she gives me. 1000 is not horrible, but definitely not as good as 500.
Shout out to all y'all on this sub. And coffee. You the real MVP.

Animus Vox
aka an audible representation of being high on Adderall

I actually just ordered a caliper + measuring tape set from Amazon which I am eagerly waiting for. Also, I think my school offers free or discounted DEXA scans for students so that's definitely an option!!

If I eat something like a bagel + cream cheese, I always put the spread on the bottom portion then the top portion. And I have to eat the bottom portion before the top portion. When I make coffee, I put Truvia in it first, move my coffee cup near the fridge, then put almond milk or creamer in it. I won't have it any other way. If I don't make my bagel and coffee this way, then I won't eat it.

Had an unexpectedly busy day today so I didn't even get to think about food. It's almost 5pm now so I think I'm going to have a few cups of decaf and call it a day.
Exercise: Horseback riding lesson: 212
Total: -212

Thank you so much for this! I know I'm at a healthy weight for my height so I'm trying not to take her too seriously. Obviously, having an ED, I definitely want to lose more weight, but she just pissed me off so much. I've really been wanting to get a DEXA scan done and see a dietician recommended to me by my therapist but $$

Yeah I'm trying not to be too hard on myself regarding the fall. There were things that happened that were out of my control. I'm just bummed because I've been so pumped for my show next week, I guess I felt like being thrown off was a bad omen.

AH! My horse freaks out about livestock. In October we were doing a show, it was at a public horse park. Some people dropped off 40 cows on the last day of the show and my horse was off his ROCKERS. I ended up having to scratch that day.
And I mean I know the cause of his bucking. My horse's legs have been getting super puffy after jumping so the vet said no jumping for a week/light hacks + Previcox for 14 days. The weather has been funky lately as well, and yesterday was his first day back jumping. So he just got super excited from the jump and it happened. I had a talk with my trainer today and she said not to worry, I did everything right and nothing could have prevented it (besides a lunge, and she took accountability for not having him lunged before my lesson).

Wow that's really caring and sweet of you. Yeah my mom is a doctor and I spoke to her last night and she said she'd put me back in ED treatment if I lost 18 pounds. I mean she doesn't know I'm engaging in ED behaviors again and plan on losing weigh more than 18 pounds. But people who know me that even though weighing 103 isn't underweight for my height, it's one of my lowest ED weights. When I was 18 I was put back into treatment when my weight was fluctuating between 98 and 102. Anyways. She is right. I'm fat and disgusting and have so much weight to lose but her attitude towards me was awful and gah I just feel like she was judging me for being so fat. Again, I'm a hypocrite. It's okay for me to judge myself harshly but I'm a fucking baby if anyone else tries to judge me.
I know and restricting is what I've been doing. I'm not upset with the *fact* I have weight to lose, I'm just upset over the shitty nutritionist I had to deal with.
Ah. I see. Yeah lots of weight fluctuations can happen so I can see why it can be discouraging. I stayed at 123.4 for 3 days even though I was restricting and I was ready to pull my hair out!

Yeah now that I've stopped crying (lol) I'm trying to take it with a grain of salt. Obviously I want to lose more than the 18 pounds she told me to lose, but I absolutely hate when anyone comments on my weight. Even if it's a compliment.
Regarding horse note: Ha that made me laugh a little! Thank you for that, it's been a rough day and I really appreciate the smile you gave me :)

The fact that there are other people in the room does make me feel a bit better, but I do think it's best you stop talking to him all together. I think it's a huge red flag that he shared *such* a serious detail about his past. Despite dealing with so many physical and mental illnesses throughout my teen years, and all my teachers knowing about it, I never had one say anything personal to me in order to try to relate.

I weigh myself first thing in the morning, so I update my flair daily. I'm obsessed with numbers (calories, weight, calories burned via exercise, BMI, etc.) and I refuse to allow anyone to think I weigh something that is not accurate/up to date.

Yeah this same teacher who betrayed my trust when I was 14 started coming on to me 2 years later and it was just a clusterfuck of emotions. At the time, I was flattered by the attention and I thought it was cool that this older woman was into me. But looking back at it, it was so sick and twisted. I can't believe myself *and* her.

Yeah this is for sure. My best friend and I go to the same gym and she said none of the staff there are really professionals or have any solid qualifications. My therapist gave me the name of a good dietician but I've been putting off seeing her since her sessions are quite pricey. The only reason I was keen on today's appointment is because it was free/I bought it with gym "points".

That's true. I just don't understand why she felt I needed the motivation? I told her I lost 14 pounds in the last 2 months (it's actually been 10 pounds in the last 1 month). She knew I work out 5 times a week (well, I did that before I started restricting again) in addition to riding my horse 4 times a week. And that I strict to a specific amount of calories + weigh/measure all my food. She even said "you're doing all the right things" so I have no idea why she was so smug in saying "you need to lose 18 pounds".
Blah. Whatever. I guess she's right regardless.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm having the worst day ever.
WRITING.TEXT:
Firstly, my horse bucked me off really badly. I'm sore and my neck is killing me. I have a competition next weekend and I'm just so embarrassed about today. I feel like I have no business riding in the first place.
Secondly, I met with a nutritionist at my gym. One of the first things she asked me was "is this the highest weight you've ever been?" I couldn't believe it. I weigh 121 pounds. I'm a size 2/4. I'm not the skinniest but I'm not overweight, and this is *one* of my *lowest* adult weights (lowest adult weight was 111, lowest weight ever was 92, usually I rest comfortably between 118 and 122 but I refuse to be that heavy).
She told me I need to lose 18 pounds of fat. I was already planning on getting back to 92 by the summer. But gah. Just hearing it from someone else makes it even worse. The worst part is I told her I "used" to be anorexic, and she still proudly told me to lose 18 pounds of fat. I guess I'm just a big **fat** hypocrite. I'm okay judging myself harshly but when someone else does it, I'm a big **fat** baby.
I guess I'm fatter than I thought I was. I feel so disgusting and ugly. I haven't been able to stop crying for the past hour and I have no one to talk to about this so here I am. I wish I could take a knife and chop off all my fat. I hate myself. I'm nothing and nobody.

Holy moly thank you for replying to this comment and validating my thoughts (considering you are a teacher). I saw this post, didn't know how to reply, then thought of a response while I was in the shower. Mistaking a teacher for a friend has still given me a fucked up perspective of teachers/professors. I was just trying to ensure OP doesn't get in over her head with her student-teacher relationship/friendship thingy. I knew what I was going to say would be harsh, so I was worried about commenting, but it needed to be said.

Okay a few things:
1) Are you under 18? Do you live in the US? If you are under 18 (and in the US at least) then a teacher is absolutely obligated to express concerns they have about a student with their parents/principle/etc. especially if the student appears to be causing harm to themselves.
2) Your teacher is not your friend. You may have some sort of friendly tendencies towards each other but he will always be your teacher first, "friend" (I use this term loosely) second. If he ever oversteps his boundary and becomes your friend, then he has absolutely no business being a teacher.
3) Now that all of that is out of the way, is there any way you can avoid meal times around him? He can't speak to your parents/principle and say he thinks you have an eating problem when he doesn't see you at times where you're meant to eat. You may not be able to maintain your "friendship" but at least you won't risk being outted regarding your eating disorder.
I am sorry if I come across as harsh or condescending. But when I was 14 years old I had a teacher who I thought was a friend. I told her about my eating issues and she told my parents and headmaster, which caused a myriad of problems for me. Because of this, I have been very distrusting of teachers. I'm in college now and I still don't trust any of my professors, out of fear that if I bring up anything non-school related with them, I'll be demonized.
To be honest, teachers do not like having *too* close relationships with students because if they have to address an issue with the student's parent/school superiors, they know it removes the trust between the teacher and student. While teachers cannot be friends to their students, there is an amount of trust that teachers hope their students have with them.

Breakfast: Granola bar (100)
Lunch: Nothing
Dinner (planned): 2 egg whites (34) + 2 vegetarian sausage patties (140)
Exercise: Horseback riding lesson (289)

Disclaimer: this was unintentional so, yeah.
When I was 14, I was put on a medication called Lamictal which *really* suppressed my appetite. I would eat a granola bar at school and come home and have a few bites of dinner. I wasn't hungry enough to eat anything beyond that in a given day. I ended up losing 6 pounds per week because of that. This all essentially prompted me to develop anorexia, but that's a story for a different day.
In general, restricting to 350-650 calories a day is what helps me the most. Anything lower than 350 makes me hungry and gives me cravings. Anything over that, I feel like I'm eating too much and won't lose weight.

I know it's easier said than done, but please don't worry about what the scale says tomorrow. If it's up, it's just water weight! There's no way you ruined a week of progress just by pizza and breadsticks. And if you're not a purger, please don't start :(
Try not to worry about your weight tomorrow - if the scale is up, just know it's water weight. Tomorrow is a new day - go back to kicking ass!

Yes, insomnia is a symptom of malnourishment. I find that putting off sleep as long as I can (1-2 hours *after* I start feeling tired) allows me to fall asleep within a few minutes and stay asleep throughout the night.
UGH girls who look good in those Triangl bikinis are my #1 thinspo.

Breakfast: Nothing
~~Lunch (planned): Vanilla Greek Yoghurt (80)~~
~~Dinner (planned): 2 egg whites (34) + 2 vegetarian sausage patties (140)~~

Exercise: Horse riding (179)
Total: ~~354-179 = **175 net calories**~~
Edit: Decided I'm coffee fasting today to see if I can hit 120 tomorrow.
Total: -179 calories

I make food decisions based on calories rather than health.
Omg I thought I was the only one around these parts who does this! I refuse to buy these nutrient dense organic granola bars because they have 140 calories, whereas Quaker Chewy granola bars are only 100 calories but full of artificial crap.

I'm definitely interested in a change. I sometimes browse Reddit on my laptop during class and it takes me a few minutes to realize I'm on /r/ProED and the person sitting behind me probably thinks I'm batshit crazy :|

I miss being able to hang out with my friends and family and not think about food - just eating what was offered and not worrying about it. But I can't do that anymore. My ED has really isolated me and I hate it.

I enjoy losing weight but I hate my ED. However I am happier losing weight via restricting low cal and fasting than I was restricting to 1000-1400 calories.
But overall, I really do hate having an eating disorder. I hate that I lie to my friends and tell them I'm busy and can't hang out, when in reality I just want to avoid food. I miss my friends so damn much but my ED won't allow me to see them because there's food involved.
I hate that I'm slightly annoyed that my mom and her boyfriend are coming to see me show my horse next week, because it means I can't get away with eating as little. I love my mom, I haven't seen her since Christmas and I'm *so* happy she's coming to see me ride for the first time. But my ED brain tells me her visit is a complete inconvenience.
I'm lonely and single and I *want* to date but I don't allow myself to date because dates involve food and alcohol 90% of the time. I have so much love to give but I'm sabotaging myself by not allowing myself to give that love to someone. Because of fucking food.
I wish I could eat a normal goddamn meal without crying myself to sleep afterwards. I wish I had the rational mind to tell myself "you may weigh 2 pounds more in the morning but it's water weight and you'll get back on track" but I'm too scared of water weight even.
I wish I could be normal but for almost 10 years I've struggled with ED behaviors and I feel absolutely trapped. It's like an abusive relationship.
I hate that I don't even want help, despite *hating* the fact I have an eating disorder.
:(
Ah, I see.
OH okay I see. I didn't know that was a thing. Thank you for the explanation! So does this woman have a large South Korean following then?

I'm not really planning on changing much this month. However, April is a very social month for me. My mom and her boyfriend will be visiting on Wednesday to watch me compete in a horse show. The following Thursday, I'll be traveling to Washington DC with my mom because she's getting some award. I'll be back home that Sunday night.
I'm not having any trouble restricting. I stick to my calorie limits and I don't get any cravings or desire to eat beyond that. My biggest struggle will be trying to get away with eating as little as possible while being social. So wish me luck! Especially since my mom is well aware about my ED past and will get suspicious if I exhibit any ED behaviors.
I'm 122.2 as of this morning. If I lose at *least* 3 pounds per week from here on, that'll be 12 pounds down by May 1st. So 110 by May 1st. Hopefully I'm able to weigh less that 110, but 110 is a good, realistic goal for me. I also have a wedding to attend on June 11th and I would love to be 100 by then, but we'll see how my athletics, travel and final exams go.
Edit: I think I might try doing more coffee fasts in April. Maybe 1 coffee fast a week. I did one yesterday because I only had 1 class, so maybe on days I don't have class (Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays) I'll try to do one.

Wait am I missing something here...why do people want to watch her eat? Is it some sort of fetish....??? I'm confused as to why someone, whether they're fat or skinny, would make this kind of video in the first place.

WRITING.TITLE: Broke my plateau!
WRITING.TEXT:
After 3 days of being stuck at 123.4, I'm finally 122.2!!! I did a coffee fast yesterday and took a diuretic and the scale has *finally* gone down. I know 3 days isn't a very long time for a plateau but I have never experienced anything like that before.
My goal was to be 120 by Sunday but I don't know how plausible that is since it's Thursday and I'm a whopping 122. Anyways, I'm just so happy the scale finally budged.
No problem :)

Yeah it's definitely common with restrictive type eating disorders. Everything you've described are symptoms/side effects/results of malnourishment. They're all bad signs, to be honest. Not eating/eating too little **will** make you sick. Of course majority of people on this sub know how dangerous what we do is as well as the consequences of it all. Correct me if I'm wrong, but most of us are simply accustomed to these feelings and understand that as long as we continue restrict/fast, we will feel these things on and off. I mean...you can't expect that starving yourself will make you *healthy* or even maintain any level of good health.
As far as I'm concerned, the only way to stop feeling this way is to be eating normally. But you can try taking a multivitamin to make up for *some* of the nutrients you are lacking. Fish oil will also help with hair growth.

While that may be true, regardless, you're constantly at a deficit during the ABC diet. You'll lose weight no matter what. I suppose your weight will drop drastically if you eat 800 one day and fast the next day, but long-term, it doesn't make a difference. You'll lose the same amount of weight in the end.

No it doesn't matter. There's really nothing special about the ABC diet. The numbers are totally random. You could make your own ABC diet if you wanted. In fact I did this years ago. I would roll a dice and the number + 2 zeros was how much I was allowed to eat per day. E.g. if it landed on a 4 I was allowed 400 calories that day.
I know. I know women who don't gain any excess weight from being pregnant aside from the actual baby. I don't know why people think pregnancy = fat.

Hmm I eat egg whites pretty much every day. I space my calories out throughout the day though. If my plateau isn't broken by tomorrow morning, I might try to eat majority of my calories earlier in the day. Thank you!

I don't know if this will work for you, but my sophomore year of high school, our school allowed us to leave campus for lunch. So at dinnertime, to get away with eating very little, I would often tell my mom "Oh I went out for lunch today and ate a lot of [insert unhealthy food here] so I'm pretty full from that."
Yeah I used to be prescribed Adderall and thought I wouldn't be able to fast without taking some. I still have some left, but I really hate the side effects.

I used to only drink 1 cup of coffee per day because I *need* it to wake up in the morning. But now that I'm drinking more, I'm realizing how much it really does suppress your appetite! I can't believe it's taken me this long to realize it. I even bought decaf to continue drinking up until bedtime.

Your sister is just jealous. Next time she brings it up, tell her you've been going to the gym regularly, then she ought to have nothing to complain about ;)
I have a friend who is an inch or 2 taller than me and ~25 pounds heavier than me/a good 15-20 pounds overweight. She doesn't know I'm engaging in ED behaviors to lose weight - she just thinks I'm eating healthily and working out a lot. She'll say stuff like "What's the point, you're just going to gain it back when you're 35 and have babies." And she'll tag me in stupid memes on Facebook like "If you eat and sleep good, exercise and always drink water, you will die anyway." She claims she's happy with her body, thinks she's hot, etc. That's nice and all, I wish I was comfortable in my own skin. But I think part of her is jealous that we are close in height and I'm much thinner than her, and will continue to get thinner.

Coffee tea fasting today!
Exercise: Horseback riding lesson (209)
Total: -209

What tends to happen is that I'll go to the therapist, convince her and myself that I'm a totally healthy, functioning adult, then I'll leave and want to live up to that, so I'll tell myself it's ok to have 1500 calories, which it totally is.
I'm kinda like this. I'll tell my therapist how great I'm doing and how great I feel. Then leave and do my weekly grocery shopping and buy tons of nice healthy foods and ingredients to cook delicious meals with....but then I come home and break down and cry and think to myself "there's no way in hell I'm going to eat any of this."
Anyways, congrats on having an awesome day! I love those awesome days - they make me feel so positive and motivated, like nothing can stop me.
I'm not worried about the hunger aspect. It just sucks the life out of me and makes me exhausted. But I'm on my 3rd cup of coffee so far and I'm feeling great :)

I'm actually not a music major. I'm a kinesiology major. I'm taking this class because it's super easy and worth 3 credits. My GPA is shit right now (something like 1.83) so if I get an A in this class, combined with other good grades, it could boost my GPA up to a 3.5.
I used to be a classic and musical theatre singer when I was in high school. I'm actually taking a singing class this semester. I really wanted to be a music major but talked myself out of it. Especially looking at music majors at my school, they have to take TONS of classes every semester because a lot of their music classes are only worth 1 credit.
What are some things you try to do to hype your metabolism?
Oh! Well I'll definitely be buying them this weekend.

You *tried* anorexia and bulimia?
Hm maybe next week I'll try hyperthyroidism.
Good luck with your fast!

Layer up! I have lots of sweatshirts from when I was super super fat, so they're really big on me now and sooo cozy. I was freezing the other day, literally shivering in my room, so I put on a long-sleeved t-shirt and one of those oversized sweatshirts and I felt much better.
Also, socks. Lots of thick, long socks.

I loooooove Sparkling Ice water. My local grocery store sells them @ 10 for $10. I'm going to try going to Costco this weekend to see if I can get a better deal. I find that these waters fill me up more than plain/regular water. Some of the flavors even taste like sodas.

WRITING.TITLE: I'm coffee/tea fasting today.
WRITING.TEXT:
On Monday I was 123.4. Yesterday I was 123.4. Today I'm 123.4!!!! UGH!!!
I wasn't going to fast because it's too difficult when I have classes, but one of my classes got cancelled today meaning I only have one. So my one class today is history of rock and roll, aka the easiest class ever, so I don't really have to use my brain or pay attention.
Gah. It stresses me out so much. I can see that I'm getting skinnier in the mirror, but the scale won't show me :( I'm so obsessed with numbers. Looking thinner isn't enough. I need to have data to back it up.
How have you guys overcome plateaus?

5 days living off just water and diet pepsi. I was 14 at the time and broke my fast because my family went out to dinner.
As an adult, I don't remember exactly how many days, but it was 4 or 5 days of nothing besides water and I fainted on the final day.

I don't really know what it is! I'll look for recipes of things that I know I would enjoy eating, but reading the recipe doesn't make me crave it or get hungry or anything. It's like eating it with your brain o.o
I'm so sorry for your loss. I had to put my dog down last July. I'm here if you need to talk, take care xx

Omg I thought I was the only one. I spent like 2 hours last night looking at super unhealthy recipes on Pinterest. I feel that I somehow feel like I've eaten them after reading the recipe. I know that makes absolutely no sense but reading recipes satisfies me so much.

I had a similar experience with Adderall. I remember once I didn't eat for 4 or 5 days and on the last one I fainted. However, low cal restricting to 100-300 calories a day, I feel faint by the 2nd or 3rd day. Maybe it's because amphetamines are a stimulant so even if your body is not nourished, your brain is still going a mile a minute?
I was amazed by them having a *cup* of rice at dinner. It would be different if rice was their main dish, but a whole cup as a side?! I can hardly finish half a cup.

I've done it before. I never did it with Lean Cuisine or frozen meals. Meals I would make for myself on higher cal days would be like, 4 oz chicken breast with some French green beans. The entire meal came to like 200 calories.

It has something to do with your metabolism. For me, eating a few hundred extra calories while being stuck at the same weight for a while has actually helped weight loss continue, however at this point, I'm too scared to eat anything more than I've been eating for the past week.
Exactly. It feels unnatural if my hips *don't* move with my horse. This is why I want to do jumpers haha.

Ugh I feel like that's how English Eq can be, too. My trainer told me the other day, "When you're riding around, pay attention to your shadow. If your body is still in your shadow, that means you're doing something right!" My horse has a really bouncy trot which is practically impossible to sit.
How is the Kiwi Strawberry? I've tried half a dozen of the flavors but never that one.

Breakfast: 1 granola bar
Lunch (planned): 1 cup Greek yogurt (100)
Dinner (planned): 2 egg 2 egg whites (34) + 2 vegetarian sausage patties (140)
Snack (planned): 28g mini pretzel crisps (100)
Total: 474

WRITING.TITLE: Any way to break a plateau without eating more?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hiya. I've been consistently restricting since the 21st, eating about 300-550 calories per day. This morning, my weight is exactly the same as it was yesterday morning. Obviously, that's not a very long plateau (maybe you can't even call it a plateau) but it's frustrating and I'd like to see the scale go down tomorrow morning.
In the past, eating maintenance calories (or even like 500 more than I'm used to) has helped break a plateau but I'm absolutely terrified of eating over 500 a day. I know fasting helps but I can't fast today because I'm in school for 7 hours and there's no way fasting will work for me.
Any ideas?
